summary: This document is an email chain from March 2021 between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel regarding a request to compile a list of all Jeffrey Epstein-related FOIA requests for a criminal discovery matter. It shows internal coordination to gather information about FOIA requests tracked through the EOUSA system.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District Of New York
persons.context: The AUSA from SDNY emails colleagues seeking help to track down a list of all Jeffrey Epstein-related FOIA requests for a criminal discovery matter.

events.title: Initial FOIA Request Inquiry
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney from SDNY sends an email seeking help to compile a list of all Jeffrey Epstein-related FOIA requests for a criminal discovery matter.
personsInvolved: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District Of New York

events.title: FOIA List Coordination
events.description: Email chain continues with personnel discussing attached lists of FOIA requests and forwarding information to ensure comprehensive data collection.
personsInvolved: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District Of New York

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office was actively compiling a list of all Jeffrey Epstein-related FOIA requests in March 2021.
This effort was connected to a criminal discovery matter, indicating ongoing legal proceedings related to Epstein.
FOIA requests were tracked through the EOUSA (Executive Office for United States Attorneys) system.
Multiple personnel within the U.S. Attorney's Office coordinated to gather comprehensive FOIA request information.
The correspondence shows systematic tracking of public information requests related to the Epstein case.
